result.execSummary:
The defendant John Raymond Finucane was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

Mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Batterers Intervention course.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Raymond Finucane

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Raymond Finucane in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant John Raymond Finucane in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Raymond Finucane appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
    
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, consecutive to case 21CM4095.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Batter's intervention course.
- No contact with MLC.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant John Raymond Finucane in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant John Raymond Finucane in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Raymond Finucane appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed.  Elements of the Offense

Parties contacted the Court via email to schedule plea/sentencing hearing. 
Information provided to the Victim/Witness Advocate.
Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 11:00 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant John Raymond Finucane not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense entered a speedy trial demand.  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 5-25-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 6-27-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant John Raymond Finucane not in court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter originally called on state's motion to modify bail.  For reasons stated on the record, state withdraws their request.  Defense counsel needs discovery and offer.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Plaisted in court.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Case heard off the record.  Court is unable to hear case today.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case remains calendared for status conference on 4/12/2022 at 1:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MLC

Defendant John Raymond Finucane in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant John Raymond Finucane in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Raymond Finucane appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
